frame.name: Identicality
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Current_instance</fen> of a certain <fen>Type</fen> is under discussion. This instance is evaluated as being the same instance or a different instance from a <fen>Previous_instance</fen> encountered in a <fen>Previous_context</fen>.
<ex>Kim has a <t>different</t> <fex name="tp">hair color</fex> every week</ex> <ex>Kim has <fex name="ci">a different hair color</fex> every week</ex>
<ex>Is this the <t>same</t> <fex name="tp">sofa</fex> <fex name="pi">as the one that used to be in the lobby</fex>?</ex> <ex>Is this <fex name="ci">the same sofa as the one that used to be in the lobby</fex>?</ex>
<ex>Dracula and your neighbor are <t>different</t> <fex name="Type">people</fex></ex> <ex>Dracula and your neighbor are <t>different</t> <fex name="soi">people</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition:
<def-root>The kind of thing of which instances are under discussion.
<ex>Smithers works in a <t>different</t> <fex name="tp">office</fex> now</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Current_instance
FE.definition: <def-root>The instance of the <fen>Type</fen> that is currently under discussion.</def-root>

FE.name: Previous_instance
FE.definition: <def-root>An instance of the <fen>Type</fen> that was encountered previously and which is now compared for identity with the <fen>Current_instance</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Previous_context
FE.definition:
<def-root>The situation in which another instance of the <fen>Type</fen> was encountered earlier.
<ex>This is a <t>different</t> car <fex name="pc">than last week</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Set_of_instances
FE.definition:
<def-root>The complete set of instances of the <fen>Type</fen> involved in the mentioned contexts.
<ex>Kent Clark and Superman are the <t>same</t> <fex name="Type">person</fex></ex> <ex>Kent Clark and Superman are the <t>same</t> <fex name="soi">person</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The Time when the Current_instance is the same or different. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: same.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: referring to a person or thing just mentioned

lexUnit.name: identical.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the very same (instance) (often accompanied by "same" or " very")

lexUnit.name: distinct.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: individual or separate of identity

lexUnit.name: identity.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: characteristics determining what something is.
